title: Chinese Singaporeans
summary: Chinese Singaporeans (Chinese: 新加坡华人; pinyin: Xīnjiāpō Huárén) are Singaporeans of Chinese ancestry. Chinese Singaporeans constitute 76.2% of the Singaporean population,[1] making them the largest ethnic group in Singapore.[2] Outside Greater China, Singapore is the only country in the world where ethnic Chinese constitute a majority of the population and they are well represented in all levels of Singaporean society, politically and economically.[3]
